content.question:
“Sunt mihi bis septem praestanti corpore nymphae,

quarum quae forma pulcherrima Deiopea,

conubio iungam stabili propriamque dicabo,

omnes ut tecum meritis pro talibus annos

exigat, et pulchra faciat te prole parentem.”

Aeneid 1.71-75

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. (A) Translate the phrase Sunt mihi (line 1) and (B) identify the case of mihi.

2. To whom is Juno speaking in the passage?

3. Write out all of line 4 (omnes . . . annos) and mark the scansion.

4. Identify one and only one of the promises that Juno makes in lines 3-5 (conubio . . . parentem).

5. How does Deiopea stand out among the other nymphs mentioned in the passage?

6. To whom was Juno herself married?

quarum quae forma pulcherrima Deiopea,

conubio iungam stabili propriamque dicabo,

exigat, et pulchra faciat te prole parentem.”

Aeneid 1.71-75

6. To whom was Juno herself married?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
